Description: Fragment of body of Fikllura pottery amphora; cream slip; at top traces of upper frieze; band of short verticals below; leaf and palmette preserved in lower frieze.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 214, no. 36)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 118, pl. XXXVI, no. 330.8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.065)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4721 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
